head.title: Infrequent Visitors To a Bird Sanctuary

hedline.hl1: Infrequent Visitors To a Bird Sanctuary

abstract.p: Photos of Iona Island, bird sanctuary just south of Bear Moutain, NY, closed most of year, during visit by members of Beczak Environmental Education Center in Yonkers

block.p: Just south of Bear Mountain, Iona Island is closed except for a few times a year. Last week, a group from the Beczak Environmental Education Center in Yonkers was taken there by Erin Copeland, an Americorps volunteer who is developing interpretive plans for the 556-acre island, parts of which have been a wildlife refuge since the 1930's.
The island was used as a vineyard in the mid-19th century before a hotel opened there. After the Spanish American War, a Naval armory was established, a few of whose buildings remain, below.

The Palisades Interstate Park acquired the land from the Navy in 1965 and designated it as a bird refuge.
